item.description:
http://porcfest.com/

http://porcfest.com/news/who-what-when-where-why-how

WHO:

Anyone that wants to come, but particularly those that love freedom and indiviudal liberty, and more specifically those that have signed the Free State Project statement of intent. 

WHAT: 

The Free State Project for the entire week, from Monday, June 20, 2011 through Sunday, June 26, 2011. Feel free to arrive any time during that week and explore the Free State. 

PorcFest is a week full of fun and excitement for freedom lovers of all ages.As previous PorcFest attendees have said, there’s simply not enough time to do every fun activity… you’ll just have to come back next year!

PorcFest will feature an entire section of the campground dedicated to kids and family fun!  Learn about homeschooling, do some arts and crafts, participate in family hikes and sports, enjoy a pool party, and go on field trips!  The fun filled week will culminate in a kids carnival, complete with a dunk tank which will raise funds for some great liberty oriented causes.

PorcFest has a full array of firearms events for seasoned gun geeks and newbie shooters alike: there will be an Appleseed marksman’s training, basic firearms etiquette and safety classes, seminars about firearms and the law, and even ammunition reloading for more experienced shooters!

PorcFest features the famous Soapbox Idol, a contest where participants can perform their own unique rants on whatever topic they deem worth ranting about!  You, the audience, can help judge whose rant rocks the hardest.  PorcFest even has its own poetry jam!  Start thinking of rhymes now!

Come and shake your groove thing on the dance floor at Buzz’s Bigger Gay Dance Party!  It’s “bigger” because last year it was called the Big Gay Dance Party, but this year it’s expanded and promises to be better than ever.  Freedom lovers of all orientations are welcome, as long as they like to dance!

The best speakers in the liberty movement will be lending their ideas to PorcFest attendees all day.  Ever wanted to see superstars like Stefan Molyneaux, Robert Murphy, J. Neil Shulman, Brett Veinotte, and Evan Nappen & Brian Aitken?  PorcFest is your chance to see them all in one place!  And of course, live Music will rock PorcFest each and every night, with a lineup of musical artists that you won’t want to miss. 

One of the highlights of PorcFest will be the amazing Agora Valley, where vendors will serve the needs of PorcFest attendees in a radically free-market way!  Buy, sell, trade, and learn about agorism – all while having a blast at PorcFest.

While you're being catered to by all of the great Agora Valley vendors, be sure not to eat too much.  You'll want to sample the dozens of dishes at the Liberty Ladies’ 5th Annual One Pot Cook-off!  Maybe you’d like to enter – there will be prizes for the best dish – but equally rewarding is being a One Pot Cook-off judge!

Watch different regions of New Hampshire compete for YOU, the prospective mover, with guided virtual and real-life tours of different activist hot spots around New Hampshire, and regionally sponsored activities like the famous FreeKeene Karaoke!

Dozens of other activities include: a pig roast featuring hogs from a Free Stater homestead, the Humans vs. Zombies tag game, a pirate themed costume party, and many, many more! You won't want to miss this celebration of individualism, individuality, and individual freedom!

WHEN:

June 20-26th, 2011

WHERE: 

Roger's Campground in Lancaster, NH 

WHY:

The Free State has been chosen and each year the Porcupines of the Free State Project meet there to show our spines. ALL who support the FSP and our goals should come to meet, mingle, befriend, and plan! 

HOW:

Any way you can. Just get there. Scrounge, bum a ride from any of the many convoys, or make some crafts or food to sell and even make your trip profitable! However you can manage to make it happen, and make it hot.

Registration:   http://freestateproject.org/registration/porcfest/2011
item.name: Porc Fest 2011
